metadata.title: CVE-2022-49032 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iio: health: afe4404: Fix oob read in afe4404_[read|write]_rawKASAN report out-of-bounds read as follows:BUG: KASAN: global-out-of-bounds in afe4404_read_raw+0x2ce/0x380Read of size 4 at addr ffffffffc00e4658 by task cat/278Call Trace: afe4404_read_raw iio_read_channel_info dev_attr_showThe buggy address belongs to the variable: afe4404_channel_leds+0x18/0xffffffffffffe9c0This issue can be reproduce by singe command: $ cat /sys/bus/i2c/devices/0-0058/iio\:device0/in_intensity6_rawThe array size of afe4404_channel_leds and afe4404_channel_offdacsare less than channels, so access with chan->address cause OOB readin afe4404_[read|write]_raw. Fix it by moving access before use them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1136-kvm - 4.15.0-1136.141
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1097-aws - 5.4.0-1097.105~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-azure - 5.4.0-1104.110~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1').
